com.facetec.sdk

Class FaceTecIDScanCustomization

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facetec.sdk.FaceTecIDScanCustomization

  • public final class FaceTecIDScanCustomization
extends java.lang.Object
    Customize the Photo ID Match Screens.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int activeTorchButtonImage
      Image displayed for the Torch button on the Identity Document Capture Screen when the torch/flashlight is active/on.
      Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_active_torch' located in application's res/drawable folder.
      int buttonBackgroundDisabledColor
      Color of the action button's background when the button is disabled during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Default is custom color.
      int buttonBackgroundHighlightColor
      Color of the action button's background when the button is pressed during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Default is custom color.
      int buttonBackgroundNormalColor
      Color of the action button's background during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Default is custom color.
      int buttonBorderColor
      Color of the action button's border during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Default is transparent.
      int buttonBorderWidth
      Thickness of the action button's border during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
      int buttonCornerRadius
      Corner radius of the action button's border during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
      android.graphics.Typeface buttonFont
      Font of the action button's text during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Default is sans-serif.
      float buttonRelativeWidth
      Control the percent of the available Frame width to use for the action button during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Relative width percent is represented in decimal notation, ranging from 0.0f to 1.0f.
      If the value configured is equal to or greater than 1.0f, the action button will be drawn to at max width within the Frame.
      If the value configured results in a width that is less than the action button's height, the action button's width will equal its height.
      Note: The Identity Document Review Screen action buttons will be drawn at half the configured width.
      Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.
      int buttonTextDisabledColor
      Color of the action button's text when the button is disabled during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Default is white.
      int buttonTextHighlightColor
      Color of the action button's text when the button is pressed during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Default is white.
      int buttonTextNormalColor
      Color of the action button's text during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      Default is white.
      int buttonTextSize
      Size of the action button's text during the Photo ID Match Screens.
      This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e.
      float buttonTextSpacing
      Spacing between characters of the action button's text during the Identity Document Capture and Review Screens.
      int captureFrameCornerRadius
      Corner radius of the Identity Document Capture Frame.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
      int captureFrameStrokeColor
      Color of the Identity Document Capture Frame's stroke.
      Default is custom color.
      int captureFrameStrokeWidth
      Thickness of the Identity Document Capture Frame's stroke.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
      int captureScreenBackgroundColor
      Color of the Identity Document Capture Screen's background.
      Default is white.

      Default is white.
      int captureScreenTextBackgroundBorderColor
      Color of the text view background border during the Identity Document Capture Screen.

    • Field Detail

      • showSelectionScreenBrandingImage

        public boolean showSelectionScreenBrandingImage
        Controls whether to show the 'facetec_branding_logo_id_check' image (or image configured with .selectionScreenBrandingImage) on the Identity Document Type Selection Screen.
        Default is true (visible).

      • selectionScreenBrandingImage

        @DrawableRes
public int selectionScreenBrandingImage
        Image displayed on the Identity Document Type Selection Screen.
        Default is configured to use image named 'facetec_branding_logo_id_check' located in application's res/drawable folder.

      • captureScreenBackgroundColor

        public int captureScreenBackgroundColor
        Color of the Identity Document Capture Screen's background.
        Default is white.

      • captureFrameStrokeColor

        public int captureFrameStrokeColor
        Color of the Identity Document Capture Frame's stroke.
        Default is custom color.

      • captureFrameStrokeWidth

        public int captureFrameStrokeWidth
        Thickness of the Identity Document Capture Frame's stroke.
        This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • captureFrameCornerRadius

        public int captureFrameCornerRadius
        Corner radius of the Identity Document Capture Frame.
        This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • buttonCornerRadius

        public int buttonCornerRadius
        Corner radius of the action button's border during the Photo ID Match Screens.
        This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • buttonRelativeWidth

        public float buttonRelativeWidth
        Control the percent of the available Frame width to use for the action button during the Photo ID Match Screens.
        Relative width percent is represented in decimal notation, ranging from 0.0f to 1.0f.
        If the value configured is equal to or greater than 1.0f, the action button will be drawn to at max width within the Frame.
        If the value configured results in a width that is less than the action button's height, the action button's width will equal its height.
        Note: The Identity Document Review Screen action buttons will be drawn at half the configured width.
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.
